head.title: In Balkans, Time to Intervene?; Misplaced Priorities

hedline.hl1: In Balkans, Time to Intervene?; Misplaced Priorities

abstract.p: Jeffrey K Baumann letter on Oct 2 article scores slow pace of NATO response to ethnic cleansing in Kosovo

block.p: The United States reacted quickly and decisively when Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait. Though the scale of atrocities and ethnic cleansing was not close to that in Kosovo, we quickly prepared for war. When the war began, we attacked the heart of Iraq, Baghdad.

The United States reacted quickly and decisively when Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait. Though the scale of atrocities and ethnic cleansing was not close to that in Kosovo, we quickly prepared for war. When the war began, we attacked the heart of Iraq, Baghdad.

You have reported for weeks on NATO's planning for a response in Kosovo. Your Oct. 2 front-page headline now states that NATO should be ready to attack within two weeks. By then, thousands more Kosovars may be homeless with new photographs of atrocities printed. To prevent a NATO operation, Slobodan Milosevic knows he can remove his troops until the outrage blows over. Then the slaughter can resume.

This situation is an embarrassment to the United States, NATO and the United Nations. It seems we didn't learn the lesson of Bosnia. On the other hand, we may find the details of the relationship between Monica and Bill far more important than the lives of innocent people far away.
JEFFREY K. BAUMANN Vernon Hills, Ill., Oct. 2, 1998
